name: dingbat
content:
dingbat noun [C]
(PERSON)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal a stupid or easily confused person: Edith may seem like a dingbat, but she's actually pretty clever. It made him look like a total dingbat.

dingbat noun [C]
(PRINTED CHARACTER)
a printed character or symbol used for decoration: People will appreciate a plain and simple letter just as much as one full of fancy fonts and dingbats.
a font (= a set of letters and symbols in a particular design and size) that consists of dingbats: If your symbol and dingbat fonts don't have quite what you're looking for, you can make your own.

dingbat noun [C]
(GAME)
mainly UK a puzzle (= a game in which you have to find an answer) in which words and their position on a page have a meaning. For example, the word "miss" written under the word "standing" means "misunderstanding": I've been trying to solve this dingbat for hours. At the end of the lesson, the teacher sometimes lets them play dingbats. Compare
rebus
mainly UK a puzzle (= a game in which you have to find an answer) consisting of one or more pictures and sometimes one or more letters or symbols that can be read together to make a word or phrase. For example, a picture of two eyes with the number "4" between them represents the phrase "an eye for an eye". Synonym
rebus
